metadata.title: CVE-2023-37644 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: SWFTools 0.9.2 772e55a allows attackers to trigger a largememory-allocation attempt via a crafted document, as demonstrated bypdf2swf. This occurs in png_read_chunk in lib/png.c.

criterions.comment: swftools: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
